bt.data

Interface ChunkDescriptor


  • public interface ChunkDescriptor
    Each torrent is split into chunks (also called "pieces").

    A chunk is a part of the torrent's collection of files, possibly overlapping several files (in case of multi-file torrents) or being just a part of a single-file torrent.

    There is a SHA-1 checksum for each chunk in the torrent's metainfo file, so it's effectively an elementary unit of data in BitTorrent. All chunks in a given torrent have the same size (determined by Torrent.getChunkSize()), except for the last one, which can be smaller.

    A typical chunk is usually too large to work with at I/O level. So, for the needs of network transfer and storage each chunk is additionally split into "blocks". Size of a block is quite an important parameter of torrent messaging, and it's usually client-specific (meaning that each client is free to choose the concrete value).

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        DataStatus getStatus()
        Check if this chunk is empty, incomplete, complete or complete-and-verified.
        Returns:
        Status of this chunk
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSize

        long getSize()
        Returns:
        Chunk size in bytes
        Since:
        1.0

      • getBlockCount

        int getBlockCount()
        Get the total number of blocks in this chunk.
        Returns:
        Total number of blocks in this chunk.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getBlockSize

        long getBlockSize()
        Get the size of a block in this chunk.

        Note that the last block might be smaller due to truncation (i.e. when the chunk's size is not a factor of the size of a block).

        Returns:
        Block size
        Since:
        1.0

      • isBlockVerified

        boolean isBlockVerified(int blockIndex)
        Check if a block is complete and verified.
        Parameters:
        blockIndex - Index of a block in this chunk (0-based, maximum value is getBlockCount() - 1)
        Returns:
        true if block is complete and verified.
        Since:
        1.0

      • readBlock

        byte[] readBlock(long offset,
                 int length)
        Reads a block of data.

        Implementations must throw an exception, if

        offset > getSize() - length
        Parameters:
        offset - Offset from the beginning of this chunk (0-based)
        length - Requested block length
        Since:
        1.0

      • writeBlock

        void writeBlock(byte[] block,
                long offset)
        Writes a block of data.

        Implementations must throw an exception, if

        offset > getSize() - block.length
        Parameters:
        block - A block to write
        offset - Offset from the beginning of this chunk (0-based)
        Since:
        1.0

      • verify

        boolean verify()
        Check integrity of this chunk.
        Returns:
        true if this chunk is complete and succesfully verified
        Since:
        1.0
